pull_request.title: chore(deps): bump nth-check and rollup-plugin-svgo
pull_request.body:
Bumps [nth-check](https://github.com/fb55/nth-check) to 2.1.1 and updates ancestor dependency [rollup-plugin-svgo](https://github.com/porsager/rollup-plugin-svgo). These dependencies need to be updated together. Updates `nth-check` from 1.0.2 to 2.1.1
Release notes

Sourced from nth-check's releases.

v2.1.1

  • The ESM code had some issues that are now fixed aeeb067

https://github.com/fb55/nth-check/compare/v2.1.0...v2.1.1

v2.1.0

What's Changed

  • nth-check is now a dual CommonJS and ESM module fb55/nth-check#206
  • With the new sequence and generate methods, it is now possible to generate a sequence of indices for a given formula fb55/nth-check#207

Full Changelog: https://github.com/fb55/nth-check/compare/v2.0.1...v2.1.0

v2.0.1

Fixes:

  • Replace regex with hand-rolled parser for nth-expressions (#9) 9894c1d
    • Ensures parsing will always have linear time complexity.

Internal:

  • chore(ci): Use GitHub Actions, Dependabot (#10) e02b4dd
  • Bump dependencies

https://github.com/fb55/nth-check/compare/v2.0.0...v2.0.1

v2.0.0

  • Port module to TS, Jest, ESLint

Breaking:

  • The main export is now a default export.
  • The module now throws regular Errors on invalid selectors instead of SyntaxErrors.
Commits
  • 639fd2a 2.1.1
  • 0eec65b fix(test): Add moduleNameMapper
  • aeeb067 fix: Fix ESM
  • 432ebc6 2.1.0
  • 3e8cd1e feat: Add generate and sequence methods (#207)
  • 57a5c62 feat: Add ESM (#206)
  • 1ce0c7c chore(deps-dev): Bump @​types/node from 17.0.34 to 17.0.35 (#205)
  • eebb040 chore(deps-dev): Bump @​typescript-eslint/parser from 5.24.0 to 5.25.0 (#204)
  • a316aaa chore(deps-dev): Bump @​typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin (#203)
  • 454c0de chore(deps-dev): Bump @​typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin (#202)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

issue.title: chore(deps): bump engine.io and socket.io

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [engine.io](https://github.com/socketio/engine.io) and [socket.io](https://github.com/socketio/socket.io). These dependencies needed to be updated together. Updates `engine.io` from 6.1.3 to 6.2.1
Release notes

Sourced from engine.io's releases.

6.2.1

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:209:20)
Emitted 'error' event on Socket instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:106:8)
    at emitErrorCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:74:3)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:80:21) {
  errno: -104,
  code: 'ECONNRESET',
  syscall: 'read'
}

Please upgrade as soon as possible.

Bug Fixes

  • catch errors when destroying invalid upgrades (#658) (425e833)

6.2.0

Features

  • add the "maxPayload" field in the handshake details (088dcb4)

So that clients in HTTP long-polling can decide how many packets they have to send to stay under the maxHttpBufferSize value.

This is a backward compatible change which should not mandate a new major revision of the protocol (we stay in v4), as we only add a field in the JSON-encoded handshake data:

0{"sid":"lv_VI97HAXpY6yYWAAAC","upgrades":["websocket"],"pingInterval":25000,"pingTimeout":5000,"maxPayload":1000000}

Links

  • Diff: https://github.com/socketio/engine.io/compare/6.1.3...6.2.0
  • Client release: 6.2.0
  • ws version: ~8.2.3
Changelog

Sourced from engine.io's changelog.

6.2.1 (2022-11-20)

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:209:20)
Emitted 'error' event on Socket instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:106:8)
    at emitErrorCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:74:3)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:80:21) {
  errno: -104,
  code: 'ECONNRESET',
  syscall: 'read'
}

Please upgrade as soon as possible.

Bug Fixes

  • catch errors when destroying invalid upgrades (#658) (425e833)

3.6.0 (2022-06-06)

Bug Fixes

  • add extension in the package.json main entry (#608) (3ad0567)
  • do not reset the ping timer after upgrade (1f5d469), closes socketio/socket.io-client-swift#1309

Features

  • decrease the default value of maxHttpBufferSize (58e274c)

This change reduces the default value from 100 mb to a more sane 1 mb.

This helps protect the server against denial of service attacks by malicious clients sending huge amounts of data.

See also: https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j4f2-536g-r55m

  • increase the default value of pingTimeout (f55a79a)

... (truncated)

  • 99adb00 chore(deps): bump xmlhttprequest-ssl and engine.io-client in /examples/latenc...
  • d196f6a chore(deps): bump minimatch from 3.0.4 to 3.1.2 (#660)
  • 7c1270f chore(deps): bump nanoid from 3.1.25 to 3.3.1 (#659)
  • 535a01d ci: add Node.js 18 in the test matrix
  • 1b71a6f docs: remove "Vanilla JS" highlight from README (#656)
  • 917d1d2 refactor: replace deprecated String.prototype.substr() (#646)
  • 020801a chore: add changelog for version 3.6.0
  • ed1d6f9 test: make test script work on Windows (#643)

issue.title: TypeError: Failed to construct ‘XRWebGLLayer’ HoloLens 2
issue.body:
### High-level description
We are experiencing issue with vtk.js examples on a HoloLens 2

### Steps to reproduce
Access any vtk.js AR example via HoloLens 2 Edge browser

### Detailed behavior
When starting an AR session from any vtk.js example directly from the HoloLens 2, we got this error:
`Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Failed to construct ‘XRWebGLLayer’: The provided value is not of type ‘(WebGL2RenderingContext or WebGLRenderingContext)’`

![MicrosoftTeams-image (6)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118812869/205026648-b4d85347-3d52-4cc6-afcf-4ed43ff18f16.png)

It should be noted that AR examples with three.js and babylon.js are both working fine.

### Expected behavior
AR session should launch without issue

### Environment
- **vtk.js**: Version used on vtk.js AR example page
- **OS**: Windows Holographic OS
- **Browser**: Edge 107.0

comment.body: #2653 should fix your issue.

pull_request.title: feat(Rendering): Add support for 16bit normalized 3D texture formats
pull_request.body:
### Context
This PR adds support for rendering 16bit normalized textures using the `EXT_texture_norm16` WebGl extension. 

~~Because this a new extension, I began by creating a small demo here (https://jsfiddle.net/sedghi/j5vnb7Lc/2/) to showcase demonstrate the functionality. This demo seem to work fine (rendering a gradient) on 5 windows machines I tested but fails on Mac. There seems to be a bug in Chromium that prevents correct rendering. I reported it and the bug is confirmed, and seems to be resolved soon (https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1246379). To run Chrome on Mac to test this PR you need to run `/Applications/Google\ Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google\ Chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/s1 --use-cmd-decoder=passthrough~~

### Changes
The default rendering behaviour remains unchanged; however, a new flag, `useExperimentalNorm16Texture`, is introduced to allow 16bit texture rendering if the extension is available.


### Data
The data I use is a 600 Slice CT to clearly show the benefit of 16 bit textures, you can reference it in the reader URL by  `https://s3.amazonaws.com/vtk.js-polyline/600CT.vti`

### Results
Reduced load time (from 5.5 seconds to 4.1 seconds in the VolumeBlends example), as well as memory footprint, without compromising accuracy.

Data: Whole body CT `Int16Array`

Case 1: `Float32` Rendering

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204637466-de30a4b6-2826-4af2-aebd-e66736bb63b8.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204637652-bc62435c-764f-4105-96ff-3938fc42fb1b.png)



Case 2: `Int16` rendering with `EXT_texture_norm16`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204637578-da78a3df-0a9e-47b6-8793-56f3a31032fc.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204637602-4120ef39-3791-4af0-b98b-e0912c243065.png)


### Remaining bugs before merge

1. To my eyes the MIP and other blend modes seem to differ from Float32, but I don't know why, it might be the following lines that we are adding for the scale to work, any thoughts @floryst 

https://github.com/sedghi/vtk-js/blob/feat/texture-norm16/Sources/Rendering/OpenGL/Texture/index.js#L1269-L1271

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204646824-47df4712-4a23-4d1a-80b7-f477947ce833.png)


2. The Radon blend mode does not work at all, I reported it here. I don't think it is related to this PR. Basically as I saw the code the `VolumeMapperBlendModes` is using `setPreferSizeOverAccuracy(true)` and when I set that to `false` the Radon transform doesn't work

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204647196-72248644-ab39-4f80-b358-fb0445264065.png)

I guess you guys just followed the example and never tried the default scenario which is `false` for `preferSizeOverAccuracy`?

CC: @swederik 

### Testing
<!--
Please describe how this can be tested by reviewers. Be specific about anything not tested and the reasons why. Tests should be added for new functionality and existing tests should complete without errors. See CONTRIBUTING.md
-->
- [ ] This change adds or fixes unit tests
- [x] All tests complete without errors on the following environment:
  - **vtk.js**: latest master
  - **OS**:  MacOS 10.15.7 
  - **Browser**:  Chrome 107.0.5304.121

<!-- Remove the line below if it is not relevant -->
_This contribution is funded by [Example](https://example.com)._

comment.body: Can we drop `useExperimentalNorm16Texture` and just use the extension presence as the toggle condition? It may be useful to only cache this runtime `useNorm16` flag once as well.

issue.title: fix(Mapper): fix update of render pass shaders
issue.body:
In PolyDataMapper and ImageMapper, lastRenderPassShaderReplacement was sometimes not updated.

It should have been updated in getNeedToRebuildShaders, but when this function was not called, the update didn't occur.

issue.title: feat(labelOutline): Add outlineOpacity to labelOutline
issue.body: ### PR and Code Checklist - [x] [semantic-release](https://github.com/semantic-release/semantic-release) commit messages - [x] Run `npm run reformat` to have correctly formatted code ### Context This PR adds outline opacity for the labelOutline property of the volumeMapper ### Changes outlineOpacity with default value of 1.0 is added to the volumeMapper for labelOutline usage ### Results without `outlineOpacity` with `outlineOpacity = 0.9` However, I observed a non-linear relationship between opacity levels. For example, any opacity below 0.8 is nearly transparent, and the difference between 0.9 and 0.99 is considerable. I think the behaviour is as a result of [here](https://github.com/Kitware/vtk-js/blob/master/Sources/Rendering/OpenGL/glsl/vtkVolumeFS.glsl#L708) when alpha is subtracted by a `pow` function (which makes it non-linear). `tColor.a = 1.0 - pow(1.0 - tColor.a, jitter);` Any thoughts on this? ### Testing - [ ] This change adds or fixes unit tests - [x] All tests complete without errors on the following environment: - **vtk.js**: latest master - **OS**: MacOS - **Browser**: Chrome 94.0.4606.71

comment.body: That's my bad. I ended up pushing a master->beta merge. It doesn't cause any actual issues, apart from email spam.

issue.title: feat(Rendering): Add support for 16bit normalized 3D texture formats
issue.body:
### Context
This PR adds support for rendering 16bit normalized textures using the `EXT_texture_norm16` WebGl extension. Because this a new extension, I began by creating a small demo here (https://jsfiddle.net/sedghi/j5vnb7Lc/2/) to showcase demonstrate the functionality. This demo seem to work fine (rendering a gradient) on 5 windows machines I tested but fails on Mac. There seems to be a bug in Chromium that prevents correct rendering. I reported it and the bug is confirmed, and seems to be resolved soon (https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1246379).  

To run Chrome on Mac to test this PR you need to run `/Applications/Google\ Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google\ Chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/s1 --use-cmd-decoder=passthrough` 

### Changes
The default rendering behaviour remains unchanged; however, a new flag, `useExperimentalNorm16Texture`, is introduced to allow 16bit texture rendering if the extension is available.

### Results
Reduced load time (from 5.5 seconds to 4.1 seconds in the VolumeBlends example), as well as memory footprint, without compromising accuracy.

Data: Whole body CT `Int16Array`

Case 1: `Float32` Rendering

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/133633961-77c320f1-7977-4200-9011-ffdcebc4b524.mp4

![Memory Foo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/133634006-6beba97b-b17e-44d2-9350-8d171bcbbecc.png)


Case 2: `Int16` rendering with `EXT_texture_norm16`

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/133634075-1b033a2d-aa4c-4df3-9e8a-d6e3bae44356.mp4



![Memory Foo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/133634108-960566eb-37b5-41a4-bca0-363569ac87c0.png)


Additive Blend seems to differ from Float32 rendering, but I wanted to open this PR to start the discussions for this addition. 


CC: @swederik 


### Testing
<!--
Please describe how this can be tested by reviewers. Be specific about anything not tested and the reasons why. Tests should be added for new functionality and existing tests should complete without errors. See CONTRIBUTING.md
-->
- [ ] This change adds or fixes unit tests
- [x] All tests complete without errors on the following environment:
  - **vtk.js**: latest master
  - **OS**:  MacOS 10.15.7 
  - **Browser**:  Version 93.0.4577.82

<!-- Remove the line below if it is not relevant -->
_This contribution is funded by [Example](https://example.com)._

comment.body: Just following up on this to see if there's any progress in addressing the PR checks. I think we're okay with merging in the experimental 3D support, and creating an issue for the 2D case.

issue.title: chore(deps): bump engine.io and socket.io

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [engine.io](https://github.com/socketio/engine.io) and [socket.io](https://github.com/socketio/socket.io). These dependencies needed to be updated together. Updates `engine.io` from 6.1.3 to 6.2.1
Release notes

Sourced from engine.io's releases.

6.2.1

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:209:20)
Emitted 'error' event on Socket instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:106:8)
    at emitErrorCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:74:3)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:80:21) {
  errno: -104,
  code: 'ECONNRESET',
  syscall: 'read'
}

Please upgrade as soon as possible.

Bug Fixes

  • catch errors when destroying invalid upgrades (#658) (425e833)

6.2.0

Features

  • add the "maxPayload" field in the handshake details (088dcb4)

So that clients in HTTP long-polling can decide how many packets they have to send to stay under the maxHttpBufferSize value.

This is a backward compatible change which should not mandate a new major revision of the protocol (we stay in v4), as we only add a field in the JSON-encoded handshake data:

0{"sid":"lv_VI97HAXpY6yYWAAAC","upgrades":["websocket"],"pingInterval":25000,"pingTimeout":5000,"maxPayload":1000000}

Links

  • Diff: https://github.com/socketio/engine.io/compare/6.1.3...6.2.0
  • Client release: 6.2.0
  • ws version: ~8.2.3
Changelog

Sourced from engine.io's changelog.

6.2.1 (2022-11-20)

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:209:20)
Emitted 'error' event on Socket instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:106:8)
    at emitErrorCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:74:3)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:80:21) {
  errno: -104,
  code: 'ECONNRESET',
  syscall: 'read'
}

Please upgrade as soon as possible.

Bug Fixes

  • catch errors when destroying invalid upgrades (#658) (425e833)

3.6.0 (2022-06-06)

Bug Fixes

  • add extension in the package.json main entry (#608) (3ad0567)
  • do not reset the ping timer after upgrade (1f5d469), closes socketio/socket.io-client-swift#1309

Features

  • decrease the default value of maxHttpBufferSize (58e274c)

This change reduces the default value from 100 mb to a more sane 1 mb.

This helps protect the server against denial of service attacks by malicious clients sending huge amounts of data.

See also: https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j4f2-536g-r55m

  • increase the default value of pingTimeout (f55a79a)

issue.title: In ReactJs : Module not found: Can't resolve ClipClosedSurface
issue.body:
I'm getting an error when I try to import ClipClosedSurface module in React,

`import vtkClipClosedSurface from '@kitware/vtk.js/Filters/General/ClipClosedSurface';`

error:
Module not found: Can't resolve '@kitware/vtk.js/Filters/General/ClipClosedSurface' in ...

@kitware/vtk.js version: 
  "22.6.1"

comment.body: `ClipClosedSurface` wasn't added to vtk.js until v25.7.0. You will need to upgrade to get the import.

issue.title: Wrong zoom in/out when mouse in moved
issue.body:
### High-level description
Weird zoom behavior when moving the mouse quickly.

### Steps to reproduce
Open any vtk.js example, start zooming with the scroll wheel of the mouse, while doing that move quickly the mouse to the top(zoom increase) or the bottom(zoom decrease), and notice the significant zoom increase or decrease.

[OBJViewer](https://kitware.github.io/vtk-js/examples/OBJViewer/OBJViewer.html?fileURL=https://data.kitware.com/api/v1/item/59cdc3058d777f31ac63de14/download)
[ConeSource](https://kitware.github.io/vtk-js/examples/ConeSource.html)

### Detailed behavior
[video-convert-1669059655246.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/878518/203145841-1ce7fbaf-390a-4cba-8b4d-12c545785af8.webm)

### Expected behavior
Zoom should only happen with the scroll wheel and should not be affected with the mouse movement. 

### Environment
- **vtk.js**: v25.13.3
- **OS**: Ubuntu
- **Browser**: Chromium 107.0.5304.110 and FF 107.0

comment.body: I suspect this is an issue with the vtkInteractorStyleTrackballCamera. I don't see this with the vtkInteractorStyleManipulator example.

pull_request.title: chore(deps): bump nth-check and rollup-plugin-svgo
pull_request.body:
Bumps [nth-check](https://github.com/fb55/nth-check) to 2.1.1 and updates ancestor dependency [rollup-plugin-svgo](https://github.com/porsager/rollup-plugin-svgo). These dependencies need to be updated together. Updates `nth-check` from 1.0.2 to 2.1.1
Release notes

Sourced from nth-check's releases.

v2.1.1

  • The ESM code had some issues that are now fixed aeeb067

https://github.com/fb55/nth-check/compare/v2.1.0...v2.1.1

v2.1.0

What's Changed

  • nth-check is now a dual CommonJS and ESM module fb55/nth-check#206
  • With the new sequence and generate methods, it is now possible to generate a sequence of indices for a given formula fb55/nth-check#207

Full Changelog: https://github.com/fb55/nth-check/compare/v2.0.1...v2.1.0

v2.0.1

Fixes:

  • Replace regex with hand-rolled parser for nth-expressions (#9) 9894c1d
    • Ensures parsing will always have linear time complexity.

Internal:

  • chore(ci): Use GitHub Actions, Dependabot (#10) e02b4dd
  • Bump dependencies

https://github.com/fb55/nth-check/compare/v2.0.0...v2.0.1

v2.0.0

  • Port module to TS, Jest, ESLint

Breaking:

  • The main export is now a default export.
  • The module now throws regular Errors on invalid selectors instead of SyntaxErrors.

  • eebb040 chore(deps-dev): Bump @​typescript-eslint/parser from 5.24.0 to 5.25.0 (#204)

issue.body:
Bumps [engine.io](https://github.com/socketio/engine.io) and [socket.io](https://github.com/socketio/socket.io). These dependencies needed to be updated together. Updates `engine.io` from 6.1.3 to 6.2.1
Release notes

Sourced from engine.io's releases.

6.2.1

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:209:20)
Emitted 'error' event on Socket instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:106:8)
    at emitErrorCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:74:3)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:80:21) {
  errno: -104,
  code: 'ECONNRESET',
  syscall: 'read'
}

Please upgrade as soon as possible.

Bug Fixes

  • catch errors when destroying invalid upgrades (#658) (425e833)

6.2.0

Features

  • add the "maxPayload" field in the handshake details (088dcb4)

So that clients in HTTP long-polling can decide how many packets they have to send to stay under the maxHttpBufferSize value.

This is a backward compatible change which should not mandate a new major revision of the protocol (we stay in v4), as we only add a field in the JSON-encoded handshake data:

0{"sid":"lv_VI97HAXpY6yYWAAAC","upgrades":["websocket"],"pingInterval":25000,"pingTimeout":5000,"maxPayload":1000000}

Links

  • Diff: https://github.com/socketio/engine.io/compare/6.1.3...6.2.0
  • Client release: 6.2.0
  • ws version: ~8.2.3
Changelog

Sourced from engine.io's changelog.

6.2.1 (2022-11-20)

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:209:20)
Emitted 'error' event on Socket instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:106:8)
    at emitErrorCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:74:3)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:80:21) {
  errno: -104,
  code: 'ECONNRESET',
  syscall: 'read'
}

Please upgrade as soon as possible.

Bug Fixes

  • catch errors when destroying invalid upgrades (#658) (425e833)

3.6.0 (2022-06-06)

Bug Fixes

  • add extension in the package.json main entry (#608) (3ad0567)
  • do not reset the ping timer after upgrade (1f5d469), closes socketio/socket.io-client-swift#1309

Features

  • decrease the default value of maxHttpBufferSize (58e274c)

This change reduces the default value from 100 mb to a more sane 1 mb.

This helps protect the server against denial of service attacks by malicious clients sending huge amounts of data.

See also: https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j4f2-536g-r55m

  • increase the default value of pingTimeout (f55a79a)

... (truncated)

refactor(reslicecursorwidget): split representation into handle representations

This allows simpler overriding of sub-widget states. Each component (center, translation line,
rotation handle) can be tweaked by changing representation.

BREAKING CHANGE: vtkResliceCursorContextRepresentation is deprecated and
removed. Instead, a vtkSphereHandleRepresentation is used for rotation
and center handles, and a vtkLineHandleRepresenttion is used for the
axes.
rotateLineInView() now takes an axis name (string, e.g. 'XinY') instead of a substate.

issue.title: TypeError: Failed to construct ‘XRWebGLLayer’ HoloLens 2
issue.body:
### High-level description
We are experiencing issue with vtk.js examples on a HoloLens 2

### Steps to reproduce
Access any vtk.js AR example via HoloLens 2 Edge browser

### Detailed behavior
When starting an AR session from any vtk.js example directly from the HoloLens 2, we got this error:
`Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Failed to construct ‘XRWebGLLayer’: The provided value is not of type ‘(WebGL2RenderingContext or WebGLRenderingContext)’`

![MicrosoftTeams-image (6)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118812869/205026648-b4d85347-3d52-4cc6-afcf-4ed43ff18f16.png)

It should be noted that AR examples with three.js and babylon.js are both working fine.

### Expected behavior
AR session should launch without issue

### Environment
- **vtk.js**: Version used on vtk.js AR example page
- **OS**: Windows Holographic OS
- **Browser**: Edge 107.0

comment.body: #2653 should fix your issue.

pull_request.title: feat(Rendering): Add support for 16bit normalized 3D texture formats
pull_request.body:
### Context
This PR adds support for rendering 16bit normalized textures using the `EXT_texture_norm16` WebGl extension. 

~~Because this a new extension, I began by creating a small demo here (https://jsfiddle.net/sedghi/j5vnb7Lc/2/) to showcase demonstrate the functionality. This demo seem to work fine (rendering a gradient) on 5 windows machines I tested but fails on Mac. There seems to be a bug in Chromium that prevents correct rendering. I reported it and the bug is confirmed, and seems to be resolved soon (https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1246379). To run Chrome on Mac to test this PR you need to run `/Applications/Google\ Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google\ Chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/s1 --use-cmd-decoder=passthrough~~

### Changes
The default rendering behaviour remains unchanged; however, a new flag, `useExperimentalNorm16Texture`, is introduced to allow 16bit texture rendering if the extension is available.


### Data
The data I use is a 600 Slice CT to clearly show the benefit of 16 bit textures, you can reference it in the reader URL by  `https://s3.amazonaws.com/vtk.js-polyline/600CT.vti`

### Results
Reduced load time (from 5.5 seconds to 4.1 seconds in the VolumeBlends example), as well as memory footprint, without compromising accuracy.

Data: Whole body CT `Int16Array`

Case 1: `Float32` Rendering

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204637466-de30a4b6-2826-4af2-aebd-e66736bb63b8.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204637652-bc62435c-764f-4105-96ff-3938fc42fb1b.png)



Case 2: `Int16` rendering with `EXT_texture_norm16`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204637578-da78a3df-0a9e-47b6-8793-56f3a31032fc.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204637602-4120ef39-3791-4af0-b98b-e0912c243065.png)


### Remaining bugs before merge

1. To my eyes the MIP and other blend modes seem to differ from Float32, but I don't know why, it might be the following lines that we are adding for the scale to work, any thoughts @floryst 

https://github.com/sedghi/vtk-js/blob/feat/texture-norm16/Sources/Rendering/OpenGL/Texture/index.js#L1269-L1271

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204646824-47df4712-4a23-4d1a-80b7-f477947ce833.png)


2. The Radon blend mode does not work at all, I reported it here. I don't think it is related to this PR. Basically as I saw the code the `VolumeMapperBlendModes` is using `setPreferSizeOverAccuracy(true)` and when I set that to `false` the Radon transform doesn't work

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204647196-72248644-ab39-4f80-b358-fb0445264065.png)

I guess you guys just followed the example and never tried the default scenario which is `false` for `preferSizeOverAccuracy`?

CC: @swederik 

### Testing
<!--
Please describe how this can be tested by reviewers. Be specific about anything not tested and the reasons why. Tests should be added for new functionality and existing tests should complete without errors. See CONTRIBUTING.md
-->
- [ ] This change adds or fixes unit tests
- [x] All tests complete without errors on the following environment:
  - **vtk.js**: latest master
  - **OS**:  MacOS 10.15.7 
  - **Browser**:  Chrome 107.0.5304.121

<!-- Remove the line below if it is not relevant -->
_This contribution is funded by [Example](https://example.com)._

comment.body: Can we drop `useExperimentalNorm16Texture` and just use the extension presence as the toggle condition? It may be useful to only cache this runtime `useNorm16` flag once as well.

issue.title: fix(Mapper): fix update of render pass shaders
issue.body:
In PolyDataMapper and ImageMapper, lastRenderPassShaderReplacement was sometimes not updated.

It should have been updated in getNeedToRebuildShaders, but when this function was not called, the update didn't occur.

Fixed this behaviour by moving the update of lastRenderPassShaderReplacement in the render function.

comment.body: `updateShaders` calls `getNeedToRebuildShaders` before `buildShaders`. Under what conditions are you seeing `lastRenderPassShaderReplacement` not being updated properly?

issue.title: feat(labelOutline): Add outlineOpacity to labelOutline
issue.body: ### PR and Code Checklist - [x] [semantic-release](https://github.com/semantic-release/semantic-release) commit messages - [x] Run `npm run reformat` to have correctly formatted code ### Context This PR adds outline opacity for the labelOutline property of the volumeMapper ### Changes outlineOpacity with default value of 1.0 is added to the volumeMapper for labelOutline usage ### Results without `outlineOpacity` with `outlineOpacity = 0.9` However, I observed a non-linear relationship between opacity levels. For example, any opacity below 0.8 is nearly transparent, and the difference between 0.9 and 0.99 is considerable. I think the behaviour is as a result of [here](https://github.com/Kitware/vtk-js/blob/master/Sources/Rendering/OpenGL/glsl/vtkVolumeFS.glsl#L708) when alpha is subtracted by a `pow` function (which makes it non-linear). `tColor.a = 1.0 - pow(1.0 - tColor.a, jitter);` Any thoughts on this? ### Testing - [ ] This change adds or fixes unit tests - [x] All tests complete without errors on the following environment: - **vtk.js**: latest master - **OS**: MacOS - **Browser**: Chrome 94.0.4606.71

comment.body: That's my bad. I ended up pushing a master->beta merge. It doesn't cause any actual issues, apart from email spam.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/133633961-77c320f1-7977-4200-9011-ffdcebc4b524.mp4

![Memory Foo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/133634006-6beba97b-b17e-44d2-9350-8d171bcbbecc.png)


Case 2: `Int16` rendering with `EXT_texture_norm16`

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/133634075-1b033a2d-aa4c-4df3-9e8a-d6e3bae44356.mp4



![Memory Foo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/133634108-960566eb-37b5-41a4-bca0-363569ac87c0.png)


Additive Blend seems to differ from Float32 rendering, but I wanted to open this PR to start the discussions for this addition. 


CC: @swederik

issue.title: chore(deps): bump engine.io and socket.io

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [engine.io](https://github.com/socketio/engine.io) and [socket.io](https://github.com/socketio/socket.io). These dependencies needed to be updated together. Updates `engine.io` from 6.1.3 to 6.2.1
Release notes

Sourced from engine.io's releases.

6.2.1

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:209:20)
Emitted 'error' event on Socket instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:106:8)
    at emitErrorCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:74:3)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:80:21) {
  errno: -104,
  code: 'ECONNRESET',
  syscall: 'read'
}

Please upgrade as soon as possible.

Bug Fixes

  • catch errors when destroying invalid upgrades (#658) (425e833)

6.2.0

Features

  • add the "maxPayload" field in the handshake details (088dcb4)

So that clients in HTTP long-polling can decide how many packets they have to send to stay under the maxHttpBufferSize value.

This is a backward compatible change which should not mandate a new major revision of the protocol (we stay in v4), as we only add a field in the JSON-encoded handshake data:

0{"sid":"lv_VI97HAXpY6yYWAAAC","upgrades":["websocket"],"pingInterval":25000,"pingTimeout":5000,"maxPayload":1000000}

Links

  • Diff: https://github.com/socketio/engine.io/compare/6.1.3...6.2.0
  • Client release: 6.2.0
  • ws version: ~8.2.3
Changelog

Sourced from engine.io's changelog.

6.2.1 (2022-11-20)

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:209:20)
Emitted 'error' event on Socket instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:106:8)
    at emitErrorCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:74:3)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:80:21) {
  errno: -104,
  code: 'ECONNRESET',
  syscall: 'read'
}

Please upgrade as soon as possible.

Bug Fixes

  • catch errors when destroying invalid upgrades (#658) (425e833)

3.6.0 (2022-06-06)

Bug Fixes

  • add extension in the package.json main entry (#608) (3ad0567)
  • do not reset the ping timer after upgrade (1f5d469), closes socketio/socket.io-client-swift#1309

Features

  • decrease the default value of maxHttpBufferSize (58e274c)

This change reduces the default value from 100 mb to a more sane 1 mb.

This helps protect the server against denial of service attacks by malicious clients sending huge amounts of data.

See also: https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j4f2-536g-r55m

  • increase the default value of pingTimeout (f55a79a)

... (truncated)

issue.title: In ReactJs : Module not found: Can't resolve ClipClosedSurface
issue.body:
I'm getting an error when I try to import ClipClosedSurface module in React,

`import vtkClipClosedSurface from '@kitware/vtk.js/Filters/General/ClipClosedSurface';`

error:
Module not found: Can't resolve '@kitware/vtk.js/Filters/General/ClipClosedSurface' in ...

@kitware/vtk.js version: 
  "22.6.1"

comment.body: `ClipClosedSurface` wasn't added to vtk.js until v25.7.0. You will need to upgrade to get the import.

issue.title: Wrong zoom in/out when mouse in moved
issue.body:
### High-level description
Weird zoom behavior when moving the mouse quickly.

### Steps to reproduce
Open any vtk.js example, start zooming with the scroll wheel of the mouse, while doing that move quickly the mouse to the top(zoom increase) or the bottom(zoom decrease), and notice the significant zoom increase or decrease.

[OBJViewer](https://kitware.github.io/vtk-js/examples/OBJViewer/OBJViewer.html?fileURL=https://data.kitware.com/api/v1/item/59cdc3058d777f31ac63de14/download)
[ConeSource](https://kitware.github.io/vtk-js/examples/ConeSource.html)

### Detailed behavior
[video-convert-1669059655246.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/878518/203145841-1ce7fbaf-390a-4cba-8b4d-12c545785af8.webm)

### Expected behavior
Zoom should only happen with the scroll wheel and should not be affected with the mouse movement. 

### Environment
- **vtk.js**: v25.13.3
- **OS**: Ubuntu
- **Browser**: Chromium 107.0.5304.110 and FF 107.0

comment.body: I suspect this is an issue with the vtkInteractorStyleTrackballCamera. I don't see this with the vtkInteractorStyleManipulator example.

pull_request.title: chore(deps): bump nth-check and rollup-plugin-svgo
pull_request.body:
Bumps [nth-check](https://github.com/fb55/nth-check) to 2.1.1 and updates ancestor dependency [rollup-plugin-svgo](https://github.com/porsager/rollup-plugin-svgo). These dependencies need to be updated together. Updates `nth-check` from 1.0.2 to 2.1.1
Release notes

Sourced from nth-check's releases.

v2.1.1

  • The ESM code had some issues that are now fixed aeeb067

https://github.com/fb55/nth-check/compare/v2.1.0...v2.1.1

v2.1.0

What's Changed

  • nth-check is now a dual CommonJS and ESM module fb55/nth-check#206
  • With the new sequence and generate methods, it is now possible to generate a sequence of indices for a given formula fb55/nth-check#207

Full Changelog: https://github.com/fb55/nth-check/compare/v2.0.1...v2.1.0

v2.0.1

Fixes:

  • Replace regex with hand-rolled parser for nth-expressions (#9) 9894c1d
    • Ensures parsing will always have linear time complexity.

Internal:

  • chore(ci): Use GitHub Actions, Dependabot (#10) e02b4dd
  • Bump dependencies

https://github.com/fb55/nth-check/compare/v2.0.0...v2.0.1

v2.0.0

  • Port module to TS, Jest, ESLint

Breaking:

  • The main export is now a default export.
  • The module now throws regular Errors on invalid selectors instead of SyntaxErrors.

Release notes

Sourced from engine.io's releases.

6.2.1

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:209:20)
Emitted 'error' event on Socket instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:106:8)
    at emitErrorCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:74:3)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:80:21) {
  errno: -104,
  code: 'ECONNRESET',
  syscall: 'read'
}

Please upgrade as soon as possible.

Bug Fixes

  • catch errors when destroying invalid upgrades (#658) (425e833)

6.2.0

Features

  • add the "maxPayload" field in the handshake details (088dcb4)

So that clients in HTTP long-polling can decide how many packets they have to send to stay under the maxHttpBufferSize value.

This is a backward compatible change which should not mandate a new major revision of the protocol (we stay in v4), as we only add a field in the JSON-encoded handshake data:

0{"sid":"lv_VI97HAXpY6yYWAAAC","upgrades":["websocket"],"pingInterval":25000,"pingTimeout":5000,"maxPayload":1000000}

Links

  • Diff: https://github.com/socketio/engine.io/compare/6.1.3...6.2.0
  • Client release: 6.2.0
  • ws version: ~8.2.3
Changelog

Sourced from engine.io's changelog.

6.2.1 (2022-11-20)

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:209:20)
Emitted 'error' event on Socket instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:106:8)
    at emitErrorCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:74:3)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:80:21) {
  errno: -104,
  code: 'ECONNRESET',
  syscall: 'read'
}

Please upgrade as soon as possible.

Bug Fixes

  • catch errors when destroying invalid upgrades (#658) (425e833)

3.6.0 (2022-06-06)

Bug Fixes

  • add extension in the package.json main entry (#608) (3ad0567)
  • do not reset the ping timer after upgrade (1f5d469), closes socketio/socket.io-client-swift#1309

Features

  • decrease the default value of maxHttpBufferSize (58e274c)

This change reduces the default value from 100 mb to a more sane 1 mb.

This helps protect the server against denial of service attacks by malicious clients sending huge amounts of data.

See also: https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j4f2-536g-r55m

  • increase the default value of pingTimeout (f55a79a)

... (truncated)

To generate a mipmap, the texture type must be color-renderable and texture-filterable according to:

issue.title: TypeError: Failed to construct ‘XRWebGLLayer’ HoloLens 2
issue.body:
### High-level description
We are experiencing issue with vtk.js examples on a HoloLens 2

### Steps to reproduce
Access any vtk.js AR example via HoloLens 2 Edge browser

### Detailed behavior
When starting an AR session from any vtk.js example directly from the HoloLens 2, we got this error:
`Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Failed to construct ‘XRWebGLLayer’: The provided value is not of type ‘(WebGL2RenderingContext or WebGLRenderingContext)’`

![MicrosoftTeams-image (6)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118812869/205026648-b4d85347-3d52-4cc6-afcf-4ed43ff18f16.png)

It should be noted that AR examples with three.js and babylon.js are both working fine.

### Expected behavior
AR session should launch without issue

### Environment
- **vtk.js**: Version used on vtk.js AR example page
- **OS**: Windows Holographic OS
- **Browser**: Edge 107.0

issue.title: TypeError: Failed to construct ‘XRWebGLLayer’ HoloLens 2
issue.body:
### High-level description
We are experiencing issue with vtk.js examples on a HoloLens 2

### Steps to reproduce
Access any vtk.js AR example via HoloLens 2 Edge browser

### Detailed behavior
When starting an AR session from any vtk.js example directly from the HoloLens 2, we got this error:
`Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Failed to construct ‘XRWebGLLayer’: The provided value is not of type ‘(WebGL2RenderingContext or WebGLRenderingContext)’`

![MicrosoftTeams-image (6)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118812869/205026648-b4d85347-3d52-4cc6-afcf-4ed43ff18f16.png)

It should be noted that AR examples with three.js and babylon.js are both working fine.

### Expected behavior
AR session should launch without issue

### Environment
- **vtk.js**: Version used on vtk.js AR example page
- **OS**: Windows Holographic OS
- **Browser**: Edge 107.0

pull_request.title: feat(Rendering): Add support for 16bit normalized 3D texture formats
pull_request.body:
### Context
This PR adds support for rendering 16bit normalized textures using the `EXT_texture_norm16` WebGl extension. 

~~Because this a new extension, I began by creating a small demo here (https://jsfiddle.net/sedghi/j5vnb7Lc/2/) to showcase demonstrate the functionality. This demo seem to work fine (rendering a gradient) on 5 windows machines I tested but fails on Mac. There seems to be a bug in Chromium that prevents correct rendering. I reported it and the bug is confirmed, and seems to be resolved soon (https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1246379). To run Chrome on Mac to test this PR you need to run `/Applications/Google\ Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google\ Chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/s1 --use-cmd-decoder=passthrough~~

### Changes
The default rendering behaviour remains unchanged; however, a new flag, `useExperimentalNorm16Texture`, is introduced to allow 16bit texture rendering if the extension is available.


### Data
The data I use is a 600 Slice CT to clearly show the benefit of 16 bit textures, you can reference it in the reader URL by  `https://s3.amazonaws.com/vtk.js-polyline/600CT.vti`

### Results
Reduced load time (from 5.5 seconds to 4.1 seconds in the VolumeBlends example), as well as memory footprint, without compromising accuracy.

Data: Whole body CT `Int16Array`

Case 1: `Float32` Rendering

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204637466-de30a4b6-2826-4af2-aebd-e66736bb63b8.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204637652-bc62435c-764f-4105-96ff-3938fc42fb1b.png)



Case 2: `Int16` rendering with `EXT_texture_norm16`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204637578-da78a3df-0a9e-47b6-8793-56f3a31032fc.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204637602-4120ef39-3791-4af0-b98b-e0912c243065.png)


### Remaining bugs before merge

1. To my eyes the MIP and other blend modes seem to differ from Float32, but I don't know why, it might be the following lines that we are adding for the scale to work, any thoughts @floryst 

https://github.com/sedghi/vtk-js/blob/feat/texture-norm16/Sources/Rendering/OpenGL/Texture/index.js#L1269-L1271

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204646824-47df4712-4a23-4d1a-80b7-f477947ce833.png)


2. The Radon blend mode does not work at all, I reported it here. I don't think it is related to this PR. Basically as I saw the code the `VolumeMapperBlendModes` is using `setPreferSizeOverAccuracy(true)` and when I set that to `false` the Radon transform doesn't work

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7490180/204647196-72248644-ab39-4f80-b358-fb0445264065.png)

I guess you guys just followed the example and never tried the default scenario which is `false` for `preferSizeOverAccuracy`?

CC: @swederik 

### Testing
<!--
Please describe how this can be tested by reviewers. Be specific about anything not tested and the reasons why. Tests should be added for new functionality and existing tests should complete without errors. See CONTRIBUTING.md
-->
- [ ] This change adds or fixes unit tests
- [x] All tests complete without errors on the following environment:
  - **vtk.js**: latest master
  - **OS**:  MacOS 10.15.7 
  - **Browser**:  Chrome 107.0.5304.121

<!-- Remove the line below if it is not relevant -->
_This contribution is funded by [Example](https://example.com)._

comment.body: Can we drop `useExperimentalNorm16Texture` and just use the extension presence as the toggle condition? It may be useful to only cache this runtime `useNorm16` flag once as well.

issue.title: fix(Mapper): fix update of render pass shaders
issue.body:
In PolyDataMapper and ImageMapper, lastRenderPassShaderReplacement was sometimes not updated.

It should have been updated in getNeedToRebuildShaders, but when this function was not called, the update didn't occur.

Fixed this behaviour by moving the update of lastRenderPassShaderReplacement in the render function.

comment.body: `updateShaders` calls `getNeedToRebuildShaders` before `buildShaders`. Under what conditions are you seeing `lastRenderPassShaderReplacement` not being updated properly?

issue.title: feat(labelOutline): Add outlineOpacity to labelOutline
issue.body: ### PR and Code Checklist - [x] [semantic-release](https://github.com/semantic-release/semantic-release) commit messages - [x] Run `npm run reformat` to have correctly formatted code ### Context This PR adds outline opacity for the labelOutline property of the volumeMapper ### Changes outlineOpacity with default value of 1.0 is added to the volumeMapper for labelOutline usage ### Results without `outlineOpacity` with `outlineOpacity = 0.9` However, I observed a non-linear relationship between opacity levels. For example, any opacity below 0.8 is nearly transparent, and the difference between 0.9 and 0.99 is considerable. I think the behaviour is as a result of [here](https://github.com/Kitware/vtk-js/blob/master/Sources/Rendering/OpenGL/glsl/vtkVolumeFS.glsl#L708) when alpha is subtracted by a `pow` function (which makes it non-linear). `tColor.a = 1.0 - pow(1.0 - tColor.a, jitter);` Any thoughts on this? ### Testing - [ ] This change adds or fixes unit tests - [x] All tests complete without errors on the following environment: - **vtk.js**: latest master - **OS**: MacOS - **Browser**: Chrome 94.0.4606.71

comment.body: That's my bad. I ended up pushing a master->beta merge. It doesn't cause any actual issues, apart from email spam.

labels.name: dependencies

issue.body:
Bumps [engine.io](https://github.com/socketio/engine.io) and [socket.io](https://github.com/socketio/socket.io). These dependencies needed to be updated together. Updates `engine.io` from 6.1.3 to 6.2.1
Release notes

Sourced from engine.io's releases.

6.2.1

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:209:20)
Emitted 'error' event on Socket instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:106:8)
    at emitErrorCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:74:3)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:80:21) {
  errno: -104,
  code: 'ECONNRESET',
  syscall: 'read'
}

Please upgrade as soon as possible.

Bug Fixes

  • catch errors when destroying invalid upgrades (#658) (425e833)

6.2.0

Features

  • add the "maxPayload" field in the handshake details (088dcb4)

So that clients in HTTP long-polling can decide how many packets they have to send to stay under the maxHttpBufferSize value.

This is a backward compatible change which should not mandate a new major revision of the protocol (we stay in v4), as we only add a field in the JSON-encoded handshake data:

0{"sid":"lv_VI97HAXpY6yYWAAAC","upgrades":["websocket"],"pingInterval":25000,"pingTimeout":5000,"maxPayload":1000000}

Links

  • Diff: https://github.com/socketio/engine.io/compare/6.1.3...6.2.0
  • Client release: 6.2.0
  • ws version: ~8.2.3
Changelog

Sourced from engine.io's changelog.

6.2.1 (2022-11-20)

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

Error: read ECONNRESET
    at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:209:20)
Emitted 'error' event on Socket instance at:
    at emitErrorNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:106:8)
    at emitErrorCloseNT (internal/streams/destroy.js:74:3)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:80:21) {
  errno: -104,
  code: 'ECONNRESET',
  syscall: 'read'
}

Please upgrade as soon as possible.

Bug Fixes

  • catch errors when destroying invalid upgrades (#658) (425e833)

3.6.0 (2022-06-06)

Bug Fixes

  • add extension in the package.json main entry (#608) (3ad0567)
  • do not reset the ping timer after upgrade (1f5d469), closes socketio/socket.io-client-swift#1309

Features

  • decrease the default value of maxHttpBufferSize (58e274c)

This change reduces the default value from 100 mb to a more sane 1 mb.

This helps protect the server against denial of service attacks by malicious clients sending huge amounts of data.

See also: https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j4f2-536g-r55m

  • increase the default value of pingTimeout (f55a79a)

... (truncated)

issue.title: Wrong zoom in/out when mouse in moved
issue.body:
### High-level description
Weird zoom behavior when moving the mouse quickly.

### Steps to reproduce
Open any vtk.js example, start zooming with the scroll wheel of the mouse, while doing that move quickly the mouse to the top(zoom increase) or the bottom(zoom decrease), and notice the significant zoom increase or decrease.

[OBJViewer](https://kitware.github.io/vtk-js/examples/OBJViewer/OBJViewer.html?fileURL=https://data.kitware.com/api/v1/item/59cdc3058d777f31ac63de14/download)
[ConeSource](https://kitware.github.io/vtk-js/examples/ConeSource.html)

### Detailed behavior
[video-convert-1669059655246.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/878518/203145841-1ce7fbaf-390a-4cba-8b4d-12c545785af8.webm)

### Expected behavior
Zoom should only happen with the scroll wheel and should not be affected with the mouse movement. 

### Environment
- **vtk.js**: v25.13.3
- **OS**: Ubuntu
- **Browser**: Chromium 107.0.5304.110 and FF 107.0

comment.body: I suspect this is an issue with the vtkInteractorStyleTrackballCamera. I don't see this with the vtkInteractorStyleManipulator example.
